Description

Plant Shift Supervisor

Company: Worley
Primary Location: CAN-AB-Fort McMurray
Job: Plant Operations<
Schedule: Full-time
Employment Type: Employee

48,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.
Wersquo;re not just engineers. Wersquo;re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers andinnovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals andresources get one step closer to solving our planetrsquo;s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition.Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.?


Whatever your ambition, therersquo;s a path for you here. And therersquo;s no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com

  1. Duties and Responsibilities

General

  • Lead by example
  • Provide consistency
  • Deal with issues quickly
  • Acknowledge others for good work

Safety

  • Hold the team collectively and each team member individually accountable for engagement in safety and safety performance
  • Act decisively on HSE issues by taking appropriate and timely action and engaging the appropriate resources
  • Promote emphasis on safety
  • Comply with policies and procedures
  • Monitor crews for safe work practices
  • Correct and coach unsafe acts/conditions
  • Actively participate in daily/weekly safety meetings
  • Ensure JHAs and FLHAs are completed with input from all workers involved in the task
  • Review Safe Work Permits, FLHAs, JHAs, HazIDs, etc. for completeness and accuracy
  • Complete at least two Leadership Activities per day

Planning


bull; Ensure appropriate resources to safely execute the work


bull; Ability to organize work teams, recognize problems and develop solutions


bull; Ensure employees are trained and qualified for their assigned tasks


bull; Have a clear understanding of the daily work scope


bull; Ensure required forms/documents are readily available


Communication


bull; Listen and act ndash; engage team in mitigation plans for identified risks


bull; Communicate with area work coordinator to ensure work tasks are prioritized properly


bull; Communicate with supervision/management to discuss work scope changes and/or issues


bull; Document occurrences concerning employee issues, client relations, etc.


bull; Provide routine oral/written feedback regarding individual and team performance

  1. Responsibilities

bull; Direct operators and work with maintenance on tasks and areas of responsibility for the day


bull; Oversee operations and maintenance activities in the field and onsite labs


bull; Interface with client and other contractors as needed for daily activities


bull; Other activities as assigned by management


bull; On-call after regular working hours while on shift to support operations and maintenance issues in the facilities


bull; Lead daily toolbox meeting


bull; Act as permit issuer for Worley operated facilities, if required


bull; Review operating data to ensure facility compliance


bull; Manage Supervisor email account and review third party lab emails


bull; Sample Receipt Confirmations (Job Confirmation Reports) to be reviewed and saved electronically


bull; Certificate of Analyses (Final Reports) to be reviewed, added to operations database and saved electronically


bull; Ensure that operations and maintenance work orders are completed thoroughly and in a timely manner


bull; Lead activities related to facility operational issues


bull; Provide back-up to operators as required


bull; Complete two Leadership Activities per day by engaging with operations and maintenance in the field


bull; Perform refresher presentations of Safety Training during morning toolbox meetings on a regular basis


bull; Respond to maintenance Service Requests from Operators and Input Work Orders in CMMS


bull; Place bottle orders with third party lab as required


bull; Order process chemicals as required


bull; Order safety equipment and operations materials as required


bull; Complete crossover notes (Weekly Summary) to document the main events from the week


bull; Create monthly facility reports as required


bull; Approve timesheets for direct reports and others as required


bull; Engage with employees during Team Meetings to provide status of present and future projects, maintenance, and corporate announcements


bull; Manage schedule changes and assignments for coverage due to vacation, sick time, training, etc. in cooperation with management


bull; Create written plans for facility operations and maintenance initiatives


bull; Review existing Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and create new SOPs when required


bull; Update operations data management system when required


bull; Other tasks as assigned by the Project Manager


bull; Support creation of annual reports


bull; Lead annual performance reviews for direct reports and others as required

  1. Qualifications
  • High school diploma or GED
  • Certification at Water Treatment and Wastewater Treatment Level II or higher in the province of Alberta, Canada
  • Five years experience minimum in operating water/wastewater treatment plants
  • Possess a valid driverrsquo;s license
  1. Qualifications
  • Detailed understanding of the principles and practices of water/wastewater treatment plant operations; operating principles of valves, pumps, and motors; principles and methods of bacteriological and chemical sewage analyses; effects and problems of industrial waste in water/wastewater treatment processes; safe work practices
  • Knowledge of computer software including but not limited to Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, data management systems and be able to operate plant PLCrsquo;s and SCADA systems
  • Additional post-secondary training will be considered an asset
  1. Conditions amp; Physical Requirements

All work will be completed in the area surrounding Fort McMurray. Workers local to Fort McMurray will be given preference. Work schedules will be a 14-on/14-off, 12-hour work days. Night shifts could also be required on a rotational basis.


The work area can involve a working environment indoors as well as outdoors, which could cause exposure to outdoor elements. Some areas can have loud noise, active machinery, high pressure fluid systems, electrical equipment, confined spaces, heights and depths, fumes, air borne particles, noxious gases, pathogens and various chemicals. The use of appropriate safety equipment will be mandatory in these areas to prevent hazardous contact.


Must be able to sit, stand, stoop, twist and bend at the waist, turn, kneel, squat, raise arms above shoulder height, grasp, reach, perform repetitive hand movements and fine coordination to work on electrical equipment; have vision sufficient to perform electrical maintenance; have hearing in the normal range with or without correction. In a 12-hour shift must be able to transport self across the facility, ascend and descend stair steps, lift objects up to 50 pounds from floor level to waist height, climb and work off of a ladder or scaffold and climb into and out of vehicles having high ground clearance; use arms and back to tighten and loosen nuts and bolts; carry a 50 pound tool box up a flight of stairs; work in confined spaces and wear and use appropriate safety equipment. Night and weekend shift rotation could be required.

What we offer you
